intro: Heliophila bursipastorisfolia, commonly known as the sun-loving leaf-bur plant, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the summer months. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture, while its root system is fibrous and shallow. Heliophila bursipastorisfolia thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges.
